bug.author: cheyang
bug.summary: Add noEvictor class to one layer of tieredstore
bug.description: Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe. In Deep learning scenario, we are using MEM layer to speed up training speed. But the eviction action in MEM layer produces additional overhead. Describe the solution you'd like Can we add noEvictor to alluxio.worker.evictor.class, and make it for MEM layer? it just doesn't add more data to MEM layer. And the deep learning application can be benefit with the memory layer without swap in and out. Describe alternatives you've considered A clear and concise description of any alternative solutions or features you've considered. Urgency Explain why the feature is important Additional context Add any other context or screenshots about the feature request here.

comments.comment:
<denchmark-link:https://github.com/cheyang>@cheyang</denchmark-link>
  thanks for proposing the idea. Wondering if command (<denchmark-link:https://docs.alluxio.io/os/user/2.0/en/basic/Command-Line-Interface.html#pin>doc</denchmark-link>

Yes, I think this one should be good for my scenario. I will try it later.

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/apc999>@apc999</denchmark-link> , I see the following error. As you know the data for training is always read-only. Any suggestions? <denchmark-code>/opt/alluxio/bin/alluxio fs pin /training-data/images/ A write operation on /training-data/images under a readonly mount point /training-data/images is not allowed </denchmark-code>

Pin should not be a write operation. <denchmark-link:https://github.com/cheyang>@cheyang</denchmark-link> let me fix this issue by PR <denchmark-link:https://github.com/Alluxio/alluxio/pull/9460>#9460</denchmark-link>
